intro: Jonesiopsis × ericksoniae, commonly known as the hybrid hoya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Jonesiopsis and Ericksonia, two genera within the same family. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and unique floral display. Jonesiopsis × ericksoniae requires bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
